title: Bihar polls: Prashant Kishor quits race, JD(U) bets on newcomers - everything that happened today
content: Bihar's 2025 election race heats up with BJP and JD(U) announcing candidate lists, while Tejashwi Yadav files nomination from Raghopur. Prashant Kishor opts out to focus on Jan Suraaj, predicting a tough fight for JD(U). The NDA appears to have finalized seat-sharing, contrasting with the opposition INDIA bloc's ongoing talks.

title: 'Nothing is well in NDA': BJP bets big on Chirag, again; Bihar allies in a tizzy
content: NDA allies Upendra Kushwaha and Jitan Ram Manjhi are expressing discontent over seat allocations in Bihar, particularly Chirag Paswan's LJP(Ram Vilas) receiving 29 seats. Political analysts suggest this move by the BJP might be a strategy to sideline Nitish Kumar post-election.

title: A failed state? Pak losing war within; how 'Quad of Terror' is taking control
content: Pakistan faces its deadliest year in a decade. Violence surges, with security personnel deaths on track to exceed 2024. Khyber Pakhtunkhwa and Balochistan are major battlegrounds. The nation confronts a 'Quad of Terror' including TTP, Baloch insurgents, IS-K, and elements within the Afghan Taliban. Border clashes with Afghanistan intensify.

title: Bihar polls: BJP-JD(U) & RJD show odd unity - the reason, Prashant Kishor
content: Bihar's political rivals, BJP-JD(U) and RJD, united in mocking Jan Suraaj Party founder Prashant Kishor for opting out of the upcoming assembly elections. Leaders from all three parties dismissed his aspirations, calling his decision a premature admission of defeat and an embarrassment to his workers, suggesting his political ambitions have been thwarted.

title: Goldman Sachs to employees: Expect more rounds of job cuts, ‘it’s become clear that…’
content: Goldman Sachs is preparing for another round of job cuts before year-end, aiming to achieve further savings and leverage efficiencies from artificial intelligence. Despite this, the bank anticipates an overall increase in headcount by the end of the year. The new "OneGS 3.0" strategy emphasizes AI's role in enhancing operational efficiency across various functions.

title: ChatGPT to soon allow erotica: OpenAI to launch new policy; safety stressed
content: OpenAI will allow verified adult users to generate erotica content from December 2025, shifting from previous mental health-focused restrictions. This new policy, "treat adults like adults," aims to offer a more personalized experience with enhanced safety tools and robust age verification. The company emphasizes responsible content handling while protecting minors.

title: Tellis tale isn't a tell-all: Scholar charged for keeping top secret files - not spying
content: Renowned scholar Ashley Tellis faces charges for unlawfully retaining national defense information and undocumented meetings with Chinese officials. The FBI's investigation, triggered by surveillance, uncovered classified documents at his home. While the think-tank community expresses shock, many argue that meeting foreign officials is part of his role, though document handling is questioned.

title: Is Virat Kohli leaving RCB and retiring from IPL? 'He will play his last match ... '
content: Virat Kohli's future with Royal Challengers Bengaluru is secure. He has committed to playing for the franchise. Reports of him leaving are incorrect. Kohli has not signed a new commercial deal as he awaits potential changes in franchise ownership. He continues to be a key player for RCB and has promised to play his first and last match for Bengaluru.

title: CeeDee Lamb injury update: Cowboys star on track for Week 7 vs Commanders
content: Dallas Cowboys' star receiver CeeDee Lamb is nearing a return from a high-ankle sprain, potentially for Week 7 against the Commanders.  Lamb has shown significant progress, participating in team walkthroughs and expected to practice. His comeback would significantly bolster the Cowboys' offense, especially in the passing game and red zone, offering a crucial boost for their playoff hopes.

title: TCS layoffs: HR chief clarifies; ‘We are not chasing a target’
content: Tata Consultancy Services HR head Sudeep Kunnumal addressed layoff concerns. He clarified that TCS is not targeting job cuts but will evaluate all employees. The company has seen a 1% workforce reduction, with further evaluations planned for those who cannot be redeployed. Kunnumal also mentioned TCS's localized US workforce and adaptability to H-1B visa rule changes.

title: From nine to all: Trump’s funding 'Compact' expands; campuses wary
content: The Trump administration has expanded the Compact for Academic Excellence in Higher Education to all U.S. colleges, linking federal funding to bans on DEI initiatives and strict caps on international students. MIT rejected the proposal, citing academic principles, while other institutions remain cautious. Experts warn the compact could deepen funding divides and challenge campus autonomy nationwide.

title: ‘Tum kisi aur ke liye aaye ho’: Jasprit Bumrah loses cool at media - watch
content: Indian pace bowler Jasprit Bumrah expressed his annoyance with the media outside Mumbai airport, stating he hadn't invited them. He was later rested for the upcoming ODI series against Australia but is part of the T20I squad.

title: Bihar polls: 30 newbies, 0 Muslims - what JD(U)'s 1st list reveals about Nitish's game plan
content: Nitish Kumar's JD(U) has unveiled its first list of 57 candidates for the Bihar assembly elections, fielding 30 new faces alongside 27 incumbents. The party aims to retain power, balancing caste equations with a focus on OBC, SC, and EBC nominees. Notably, no Muslim candidates were included in this initial selection.

title: Trade Rumor: Red Sox tipped to land $80M Phillies star to boost offense
content: Boston Red Sox are eyeing a reunion with powerful free agent Kyle Schwarber, a former fan favorite. A potential sign-and-trade could send outfielder Jarren Duran and a pitching prospect to Philadelphia. This move would inject much-needed power into Boston's lineup and offer the Phillies financial flexibility and defensive upgrades, creating a win-win scenario for both clubs.

title: Analyst links Adrian Kempe to Oilers in possible McDavid pairing
content: Speculation is mounting that the Edmonton Oilers could pursue Los Angeles Kings forward Adrian Kempe next season. With Connor McDavid reportedly taking a team-friendly deal, cap flexibility may allow the Oilers to acquire a high-profile winger. Kempe's uncertain contract status with the Kings fuels these rumors, as he could be a perfect fit alongside McDavid.

title: Kelly Stafford’s note to Hailee Steinfeld wins hearts across NFL
content: NFL star Josh Allen praised his wife Hailee Steinfeld. Matthew Stafford's wife Kelly Stafford shared Allen's interview, wishing every player had such support. Her message went viral, celebrating the quiet strength of spouses. This highlights the vital role partners play in the lives of football stars, both on and off the field.

title: Bears in the house: Polar giants chilling in abandoned Arctic station - see images
content: Remarkable drone footage reveals polar bears seeking refuge in an abandoned Russian research station on Kolyuchin Island. Photographer Vadim Makhorov captured these images, showcasing the bears' adaptability as their natural sea ice hunting grounds shrink. This unusual sight highlights the impact of climate change on Arctic wildlife and their interaction with forgotten human structures.

title: 'Forgive me': Bengal rape victim's father calls Mamata 'mother-like'; seeks justice
content: The father of Durgapur gang rape victim has sought forgiveness from Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee after previously criticizing her remarks on women's safety. He described Banerjee as a "mother-like figure" and pleaded for her help in securing justice for his daughter, urging her to forgive any harsh words spoken earlier.

title: Half a million likes and counting! Gill's post with Kohli breaks internet - See pic
content: Team India's departure for Australia showcased a positive transition with new ODI captain Shubman Gill embracing leadership.  Gill's camaraderie with Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli set an encouraging tone for the upcoming series, which marks the start of a new cycle towards the 2027 World Cup. Both Rohit and Kohli return to the ODI squad for the tour.

title: Af-Pak clashes: 48-hr ceasefire declared after deadly skirmishes - who asked for truce first?
content: Pakistan and Afghanistan have agreed to a 48-hour ceasefire starting Wednesday evening, following a week of deadly cross-border clashes. This truce, requested by the Afghan Taliban, aims to de-escalate tensions and facilitate dialogue. The agreement follows Pakistan's precision strikes in Kandahar and Kabul in retaliation for attacks that claimed the lives of 23 Pakistani soldiers.

title: 'China will hurt most': US trade czar attacks Beijing over 'chaos'; Trump ready to meet Xi
content: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent criticised China's new rare earth export restrictions as a "China versus the world" move, vowing allies will "neither be commanded nor controlled." He urged de-risking and diversifying supply chains away from China, while hinting at a potential tariff pause if Beijing delays its curbs.

title: Karur stampede: Relief for TVK; 2 top party leaders get bail
content: TVK Karur district secretary V P Mathiazhagan and central town secretary Masi Pavunraj are set for release from jail after a court rejected the police's request for extended custody. Their arrests were linked to the tragic stampede at actor Vijay's rally in Karur on September 27, which resulted in 41 fatalities.

title: India's growth 'very strong': RBI guv dismisses Trump tariff worries; 'not a huge concern'
content: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra highlighted India's robust macroeconomic fundamentals and significant market depth during IMF meetings. He noted increasing capacity utilization and well-managed inflation, despite global uncertainties and policy shifts.  Malhotra also pointed to manageable fiscal deficit and strong growth projections, emphasizing orderly rupee movement.

title: Dhruv Rathee questions Shah Rukh Khan about endorsement choices
content: YouTuber Dhruv Rathee has sparked a debate by questioning Shah Rukh Khan's endorsement of paan masala products, given the actor's substantial USD 1.4 billion net worth. Rathee argued Khan's wealth allows him to forgo such deals, while critics lauded the call for responsible influence. Counterarguments cited contract complexities and legal advertising frameworks.

title: ESPN’s Chris Russo reveals what really pushed Molly Qerim to quit First Take
content: Molly Qerim's abrupt departure from ESPN's First Take has sparked speculation. Chris Russo suggests she left to avoid perceived embarrassment from a quiet replacement, while Marcellus Wiley points to pay disparity and unapproved show ideas. ESPN's Burke Magnus confirmed contract talks failed, indicating Qerim sought a fresh start after a decade.

title: Shocking! No Rohit Sharma, no Virat Kohli: Pat Cummins reveals ODI XI
content: Australian captain Pat Cummins will be absent from the upcoming white-ball series against India due to injury. Mitchell Marsh will lead both the ODI and T20I squads. Cummins revealed his all-time India-Australia ODI XI. Mitchell Starc will spearhead the bowling attack in the ODI series. Marsh's recent form makes him a strong leader.

title: Ahmedabad recommended as Commonwealth Games 2030 host
content: India's capital, Ahmedabad, has been recommended by Commonwealth Sport's Executive Board to host the 2030 Commonwealth Games. This marks the second time India will host the event, following the 2010 Delhi Games. The decision, pending formal confirmation in November, highlights India's growing sporting prowess and infrastructure capabilities.

title: Maharashtra flags 152 MBBS aspirants: Fudged documents caught; seat blocking probed
content: Maharashtra’s CET Cell has launched a strict verification drive after uncovering discrepancies in documents submitted for NEET-UG 2025 Round-3 admissions. Following a TNN investigation that revealed candidates holding seats elsewhere reappearing in the state merit list, 152 students have been asked to re-upload original documents by October 16. The move aims to curb seat-blocking and restore credibility in medical admissions.

title: Nations dropping out of Brics? Trump makes wild claim; at odds with India again
content: Donald Trump falsely claimed BRICS nations are withdrawing after he threatened tariffs on their exports if they challenged the US dollar. Despite Trump's assertions, BRICS has expanded to 20 members, with Saudi Arabia being the only country to demur. India is set to chair BRICS in 2026, prioritizing developing nations' concerns.

title: Af-Pak border clash: Dozens dead; Taliban captures tanks & outposts - new visuals emerge
content: Intense border clashes erupted between Afghanistan and Pakistan along border area, claiming 15 Afghan civilian lives and leaving many injured. Both nations reported inflicting damage on the other's military assets, including tanks, weapons and posts. This escalation follows recent reciprocal strikes and ongoing disputes over border security and alleged militant harboring.

title: What were Ashley Tellis' views on India, US, and China?
content: In his much-discussed 2025 essay “India’s Great-Power Delusions” in Foreign Affairs, Tellis argued that India’s ambitions far exceed its capabilities. New Delhi, he wrote, aspires to become a pole in a multipolar world but remains constrained by slow economic growth, limited military capacity, and weak institutions.

title: India-US trade deal cose? Talks pick up pace; Delhi working on 'win-win' solution
content: India and the United States are engaged in extensive trade talks. Discussions are progressing at various levels with a focus on finding mutually beneficial outcomes. India's exports to the US are experiencing consistent growth. The Indian negotiating team is currently in the United States for further deliberations. Both nations are committed to achieving a positive resolution.

title: Virat Kohli stops security, gives fan the moment of a lifetime - Watch
content: Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma are set to return to international cricket for India's ODI series against Australia, commencing October 19. The duo, who last played in the Champions Trophy eight months ago, departed for Perth after Kohli shared a heartwarming moment with a young fan. The three-match series will also see Shubman Gill lead the ODI squad.

title: Ellie-Jean Coffey gets death threats after false India sacred lake video claim
content: Australian surfer Ellie-Jean Coffey is facing death threats after a video of her urinating off a boat in Western Australia was falsely shared as her defecating in a sacred Indian lake. The 30-year-old clarified the mix-up, stating she has never been to India and the incident occurred in the Aussie outback, not Udaipur.

title: US passports drop in 2025 Henley Index: Top 10 strongest passports revealed
content: The US passport has dropped to 12th place, its lowest ever, losing ground to Asian nations like Singapore and South Korea which now lead global travel freedom. This shift, driven by changing visa policies and growing Asian influence, means US citizens face more travel hurdles. European passports, meanwhile, continue to strengthen their international access.

title: Zubeen Garg case: Fans attack convoy taking accused to jail - watch
content: Violence erupted outside Baksa District Jail as five individuals accused in singer Zubeen Garg's death were transferred there. A crowd demanding justice for the late singer pelleted stones at the police convoy. The accused, including festival organizers and security personnel, were moved following court concerns for their safety.

title: Indian-origin US adviser held: Why he’s under scrutiny; what FBI found at his home
content: An Indian-origin scholar, identified as Tellis, has been detained by US authorities on charges of unlawfully retaining over 1,000 pages of classified national defense information. The documents, marked "SECRET" and "TOP SECRET," were discovered at his Virginia home. Authorities also allege Tellis met with Chinese officials multiple times.

title: 'JD(U) not run by Nitish': Tejashwi says 3 leaders 'bought by BJP' now in control - watch
content: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav alleged that the JD(U) is no longer controlled by Nitish Kumar, but by leaders "bought by the BJP." He claimed Lalan Singh, Sanjay Jha, and Vijay Choudhary have taken over and "destroyed Nitish Kumar." This comes as JD(U) announced its first list of 57 candidates for the Bihar Assembly elections, approved by Nitish Kumar.

title: Bihar polls: BJP mocks Kishor for not contesting; calls move sign of 'weakness'
content: The BJP has taken a jibe at Jan Suraaj Party founder Prashant Kishor, suggesting he has decided to withdraw from the Bihar assembly elections. BJP national spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla claimed Kishor, a businessman and former election campaigner, realised the ground situation is not in his favor.

title: 'Arey hero': Old meets new - Rohit Sharma greets new ODI captain Shubman Gill
content: A heartwarming video captured Rohit Sharma embracing Shubman Gill, his successor as ODI captain, ahead of India's upcoming series in Australia.  Virat Kohli and Shreyas Iyer also greeted Gill warmly.  Amidst speculation about Rohit and Kohli's ODI futures, Gautam Gambhir emphasized focusing on the present and their valuable experience for the Australian tour.

title: 'Vijay was 7 hrs late': Stalin blames TVK chief for congestion that led to Karur stampede
content: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin blamed crowd management and actor-politician Vijay for the Karur tragedy that killed 41. He highlighted the delay in Vijay's arrival, inadequate facilities, and organizers' refusal to halt the caravan against police advice, leading to severe congestion and deaths. The government has initiated investigations and compensation.

title: Simone Biles opens up on mental health struggles during Argentina trip
content: Gymnastics icon Simone Biles inspired young athletes in Buenos Aires, emphasizing the strength in seeking help for mental health struggles.  Having overcome her own "twisties," Biles shared that prioritizing mental well-being was key to her recent successes. Her visit included motivational talks and a clinic, leaving a lasting positive impact.

title: Balancing lives and conservation
content: Kerala amends wildlife laws to tackle rising human-wildlife conflicts while raising concerns over ecological impact

title: Bihar polls: BJP announces third list of 18 candidates
content: In the third list, BJP has fielded Satish Kumar Yadav from Raghopur Assembly seat to take on former Deputy Chief Minister and RJD Leader Tejashwi Yadav.

title: LDF takes out rally, holds public meeting in Perambra
content: Senior CPI(M) leader accuses Cong. activists of assaulting Perambra panchayat president without any provocation

title: Karnataka Social and Educational Survey: Enumerators struggle amid long hours of work and hostile responses
content: As on Wednesday, out of a total of about 46 lakh households to be surveyed under Greater Bengaluru Authority limits, a little over 15 lakh were covered

title: Karnataka to ready 300-acre data centre park at Tavarekere in 18 months
content: According to industry experts, Maharashtra and Tamil Nadu are quite ahead of Karnataka in terms of data centre infrastructure

title: Bihar polls: BJP firefights as allies protest ‘disproportionate’ seats for Chirag Paswan
content: Two NDA allies, Upendra Kushwaha’s Rashtriya Lok Morcha (RLM) and Jitan Ram Manjhi’s Hindustan Awam Morcha, have publicly expressed their displeasure; JD(U) has also conveyed its objections while refraining from making any public remarks

title: Haryana Chief Minister Nayab Saini assures justice and support to family of deceased ASI
content: His family says it would allow the post-mortem only after a case is registered, demands probe into four-page note and video left by him

title: Supreme Court summons top State health officials in a sharp rebuke of their “casual approach” to framing ICU/CCU treatment norms
content: Officials must appear personally in court on November 20 to explain their failure to obey an earlier SC order passed in a medical negligence case; model ICU/CCU guidelines cannot be implemented without State inputs

title: Supreme Court issues notice on plea seeking access to lawyer during inquiry
content: The petition says that though the right to consult a lawyer during an inquiry is statutorily recognised, it is not uniformly enforced by investigating agencies

title: Battleground Bhabanipur: Mamata says outsiders filling up her constituency, Suvendu vows to defeat her
content: West Bengal CM says slums are being replaced by highrises full of outsiders, driving her voters away from Bhabanipur; Leader of Opposition says BJP leads in five out of eight wards in the constituency

title: Vellore Corporation issues NOC to relay VIT Road near Katpadi station
content: Corporation officials said that the stretch, which is 2.6 km long and 14 metres wide, was taken up to lay underground pipelines and construction of manholes for drainage work more than six months ago.

title: BJP Announces All 101 Names For Bihar, Releases 3rd List Of 18 Candidates
content: Late on Wednesday night, the BJP announced its third list of 18 candidates, taking the total count of declared candidates to 101, also the number of seats allotted to the party in the final seat-sharing distribution within the NDA for Bihar polls.

title: Stringent NSA Invoked Against Main Accused Of 2024 Sambhal Violence
content: Police on Wednesday invoked the stringent National Security Act against the alleged mastermind behind last year's communal violence here over a court-ordered survey of a Mughal-era mosque in the district.

title: Israel Returns 45 Palestinian Bodies To Gaza Authorities
content: Israel returned the bodies of 45 Palestinians to Gaza authorities, the Hamas-run health ministry said, bringing the total number handed over as part of a US-brokered ceasefire deal to 90.

title: 71-year-Old Arrested For Attempt To Murder After Evading Cops For 48 Years
content: Criminals may be adept at faking identities, but police are masters of busting deceptions, which was evident when they traced and arrested a 71-year-old man wanted in an attempt to murder case.

title: Made-in-India Combat Parachute Clears 32,000-Foot Test In Major Milestone
content: In a major development, the Military Combat Parachute System (MCPS), indigenously developed by DRDO, has successfully undergone a combat free-fall jump from an altitude of 32,000 feet, the Ministry of Defence (MoD) said on Wednesday.

title: 2 Officials Suspended In Rajasthan Bus Fire Case In Which 21 Died
content: Taking disciplinary action following the Jaisalmer sleeper bus fire tragedy, which claimed 21 lives in Jaisalmer, the Rajasthan Transport Department suspended two officials from Chittorgarh.

title: Focused Sound Energy Promises To Treat Cancer, Alzheimer's: Report
content: Focused ultrasound treatments for essential tremor are now performed routinely at many locations around the world.

title: List Of Districts "Most-Affected" By Maoist Extremism Halved To 3: Centre
content: In what the government is terming a major achievement towards its goal of a "Naxal-free Bharat," the number of districts "most affected" by Left Wing Extremism (LWE) has halved to three - Bijapur, Sukma, and Narayanpur in Chhattisgarh.

title: Meitei Community Seeks Probe Into Demolition Of Iconic Heritage Bungalow In Shillong
content: Members of the Meitei community in Meghalaya's Shillong came out in large numbers in protest against the demolition of an iconic building that served as the home of the last king of Manipur.

title: Big AI Push: Google Partners With Hyderabad College To Train 50,000 Students
content: A major push to digitise and modernise technical education was launched today in the Medchal district of Hyderabad, with the inauguration of a large-scale collaboration between the Malla Reddy Group of Institutions and Google.

title: Pay Rs 30,000 A Month As Maintenance To 4th Wife: Court To Samajwadi Party MP
content: The Allahabad High Court has directed Samajwadi Party MP from Rampur, Mohibbullah Nadvi, to pay monthly maintenance to his fourth wife regularly or face legal consequences.

title: India's Exports To US Dip 11.93%, Imports Up 11.78% in September
content: India's merchandise exports to the US declined by 11.93 per cent to USD 5.46 billion in September due to the high tariffs imposed by Washington while imports increased by 11.78 per cent to USD 3.98 billion during the month.

title: Haryana IPS Officer's Wife Named In FIR By Investigating Cop's Widow
content: Her husband, Haryana IPS officer Y Puran Kumar, died by suicide last week. A week later, the officer's wife, Amneet Kumar, an IAS officer, faces a police case filed by the wife of a cop who was investigating her husband.

title: Odisha Woman Official Drops Daughter At School, Then Found Hanging At Home
content: A woman agriculture officer was found hanging in her rented house in Odisha's Bhadrak district on Wednesday, police said. Police identified the woman as Niharika Dalai, 30, a native of Randia village under Bhadrak Rural police station.

title: Maharashtra Jail Official Transferred Amid Forced Conversion Charges
content: The Maharashtra prison department on Wednesday transferred Beed district jail superintendent Petrus Gaikwad to Nagpur with immediate effect, following allegations of forcible religious conversion and ill-treatment of inmates.

title: India Falls 5 Places In Passport Index, This Country Remains No. 1 In World
content: India has fallen to the 85th rank in the 2025 Henley Passport Index, offering visa-free access to 57 countries. Last year, India's passport was ranked 80th on the list with visa-free travel to 62 destinations.

title: "Pregnancy An Excuse": Karnataka MLA's Remark On Woman Forest Officer Sparks Row
content: An MLA of the ruling Congress party in Karnataka has triggered a massive row over his comments on a woman officer of the forest department. A video of the MLA making sexist comments against the woman officer has also surfaced.

title: 'First Responder': India Steps In As Indonesia Battles Caesium-137 Crisis
content: India has rushed a consignment of Prussian Blue (Pru-Decorp) capsules to Indonesia to help mitigate the effects of Cesium-137 contamination after Jakarta detected traces of radioactivity in exported food products.

title: Step Aside, Popemobile: Pope Gets A White Purebred Horse
content: Pope Leo XIV was given a 12-year-old white purebred Arabian horse, "Proton", a present from a Polish breeder.

title: 'He's Sitting There, Hoping They'll Return': Man Loses 3 Grandchildren In Bus Fire
content: When a bus caught fire in Rajasthan's Jaisalmer on Tuesday, 21 people died and at least 15 were injured. But behind these numbers lie deeply personal tragedies, including a man who has lost three granddchildren.

title: Jaisalmer bus tragedy: How vehicle bought 5 days ago became death trap
content: A private bus, recently converted to AC, erupted in flames near Jaisalmer, claiming 20 lives, including three children. A suspected short circuit in the AC system caused the rapid spread of fire, trapping passengers. Rescue efforts were hampered by intense heat. Investigations into the bus operator and modification are underway.

title: NSA Ajit Doval in Bishkek for meeting security partners of Central Asia
content: The overall security situation, especially the Afghanistan-Pakistan border conflict, is expected to be part of the discussion

title: Karnataka to upgrade 800 govt. schools to KPS at ₹3,000 crore
content: KPS are model government-run schools that provide education from pre-primary to II PU under one roof, with both English and Kannada medium options

title: Book on Mannarsala Sree Nagaraja Temple released
content: The 96-page book, featuring a sweeping range of photographs, explores the unique socio-religious and ecological landscape of one of the country’s most important centres of Naga worship

title: Night light data reveals limited urban growth in Bihar
content: Nighttime illumination is used as a proxy to gauge electricity usage and identify levels of urbanisation; very high illumination rose from 0% in 2013 to 1.6% in 2023, and was seen only in Patna

title: Sundarbans aquaculture model wins FAO global recognition
content: Nature Environment and Wildlife Society’s mangrove-linked aquaculture project lauded as a model for sustainable livelihoods

title: BJP announces nominees for Assembly bypolls in Jharkhand, Odisha, Telangana and J&K
content: All the bypolls are scheduled to be held on November 11, along with the second phase of the Bihar Assembly election

title: Andhra Pradesh needs SCS, not GST festivals, says APCC chief Y.S. Sharmila
content: There is no truth in the government’s claims that GST cuts increased people’s purchasing power, she asserts

title: Andhra Pradesh electricity employees’ talks with power utilities on October 17
content: The AP State Power Employees’ Joint Action Committee to hold a fresh round of negotiations with Chief Secretary Vijayanand on a host of demands

title: Veteran singer Rao Balasaraswati passes away
content: Andhra Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister Pawan Kalyan remembered her as a first-generation singer and actress who earned a special place in classical and light music

title: Over 11,000 applications received for next Haj season
content: Telangana was allotted a quota of 4,292 seats and 3,453 were selected by means of drawing lots; 4,617 applicants on the waiting list

title: Record number of women officers, major career shifts shape Telangana’s latest IPS cohort
content: With 35.63% women officers, the highest in past five years, this year’s cohort graduating from Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel National Police Academy marks a big stride towards inclusivity in police leadership

title: ‘Will appeal to government to give 200 more units of free power for hair cutting salons in A.P.’
content: Present government has increased the wages of barbers working in temples from ₹20,000 to ₹25,000, says State Nayee Brahmin Sadhikara Samithi president

title: CBI probe essential on Sabarimala gold ‘theft’, says Kodikunnil Suresh
content: Congress leader lashes out at CPI(M) and LDF government during Vishwasa Samrakshana Yatra in Thrissur district

title: Pakistan a ‘breeding ground of terrorism’, says J&K L-G Manoj Sinha
content: Lieutenant Governor pledges to dismantle terror ecosystem in the Union Territory and ensure justice for victims’ families

title: Tourism Minister Durgesh urges Centre to allocate more projects to Andhra Pradesh
content: At a meeting in Udaipur, he urges Union Minister of Culture and Tourism Gajendra Singh Shekhawat to sanction a culinary institute in Tirupati, Tourism Bhavan in Amaravati, and National School of Drama in Rajamahendravaram

title: ₹13.69 crore tax arrears case: Madras High Court directs Jayalalithaa’s niece Deepa to implead her brother Deepak
content: Justice C. Saravanan grants time till November 3 for J. Deepa’s counsel to implead her brother J. Deepak too as a respondent to her writ petition challenging the recovery notice

title: Two-day TiE Hyderabad Entrepreneurship Summit from Oct. 31
content: The summit comes in the backdrop of Hyderabad’s tech startups in 2024 reporting 160% jump in funding, reaching $571 million across 81 rounds, which was a strong rebound in the post-funding-winter climate

title: IT Minister Lokesh inaugurates Tata Hitachi Construction Machinery Company dealership at Atmakur in Andhra Pradesh
content: Such dealerships are as important as Google for generating employment, which is on top of the government’s agenda, he says

title: New library in Hyderabad opens its doors, old one awaits rebirth
content: Recently-opened Coforge Public Library in Kondapur is drawing eager readers with its modern charm, even as the 134-year-old State Central Library in Afzalgunj remains partly inaccessible while its building undergoes restoration

title: Insufficient workforce hits pace of NH widening works in Kozhikode
content: The decision, taken at a district-level meeting convened by District Collector, has not been implemented, leading mainly to slow progress on Vengalam–Azhiyoor stretch

title: ‘Farmer Champions’ initiative launched in Nellore to make agriculture profitable for farmers
content: New approach aims at promoting market-oriented cultivation across 722 gram panchayats of 37 mandals in the district on an experimental basis for the coming two years, says Nellore Collector

title: Fowler and Graziano: Intel on the Eagles, Titans and 49ers ahead of NFL Week 7, plus looming trades
content: Are the Eagles worried about their offense? What's next for the Titans after firing Brian Callahan? And could the 49ers be active at the trade deadline?

title: Jets coach dismisses Hall trade chatter: 'Rumors'
content: Jets coach Aaron Glenn dismissed the renewed trade speculation surrounding Breece Hall, reiterating what he said in the preseason: They have no plans to trade their No. 1 running back.

title: Source: 'Outrage' over surface at Steelers field
content: Players from the Steelers and Browns expressed "outrage" and concerns to the NFLPA about the "embarrassing" playing surface at last weekend at Acrisure Stadium, a union source told ESPN.

title: Westbrook agrees to join Kings for 18th season
content: Nine-time NBA All-Star Russell Westbrook has agreed on a deal to sign with the Kings, agent Jeff Schwartz of Excel Sports Management told ESPN.

title: Jaguars eyeing bigger offensive role for Hunter
content: The Jaguars are making it a priority to design and call bigger offensive plays for Travis Hunter to take advantage of his speed, coach Liam Coen said.

title: Foligno taking leave for daughter's heart surgery
content: Blackhawks captain Nick Foligno is taking a leave of absence because his 12-year-old daughter is having follow-up surgery related to congenital heart disease.

title: KU, Texas Tech fined $25K each over fan dispute
content: The Big 12 fined Kansas and Texas Tech $25,000 each on Wednesday for the fallout of a dispute over fan behavior in Saturday's game.

title: Suit seeks to allow top HS WR to profit from NIL
content: Jamier Brown, the top wide receiver in the class of 2027, is the centerpiece of an NIL lawsuit filed against the Ohio High School Athletic Association, which is now considering changing its rules.

title: NHL players may play on untested ice at Olympics
content: Organizers for the 2026 Milan-Cortina Games say construction delays at the primary hockey arena may force the Olympic event, which will include the return of NHL players for the first time in over a decade, to be played on untested ice.

title: 📉 Bottom 10: Franklin's last act at Penn State
content: After a stunning free fall, Penn State's coach is out of a job but still has a spot on our list of outcasts.

content: When Reggie Bush shoved Matt Leinart into the end zone, it saved USC's season and ignited a debate that still lingers.

title: Cooper Flagg put the league on notice before he ever played an NBA game
content: Flagg's NBA coming out party was last summer as he nearly upset Team USA ahead of the Paris Olympics.

title: Leh court grants bail to Congress councillor, six others in September 24 violence case
